Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2007002599.CaseDesc: Mrs. Agnes May Appleyard was last seen standing in her yard, Lot # 2, Conc., # 4 McMurrich Township, Emsdale, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2020040144.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1950, Mabel Crumback was seen for the last time at approximately 12:30 am at her home located in Toronto, Ontario. Mabel had been babysitting her younger brother while her family was out of town. The following morning, she was gone.

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval.  Mr. Marabella was at a service station on Highway 440 between Hwys. 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mr. Marabella's car, a grey Acura MDX was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which Mr. Marabella was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal.  Mr. Marabella was known to be involved in organized crime.  He was linked to the Italian Mafia.

Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss
Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005003199.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1990, an unidentified man was found near the Hydro Plant in the Niagara River. He had short fingernails with dirt embedded underneath them and callouses on his hands. His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Hair: Black, Shorter than collar length with dark bushy eyebrows
Scar: Left Index Finger, old scar at the base of the finger
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, small mole

Case reference: 2014005327.CaseDesc: Edward Tandrup was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in February of 1983. Edward Tandrup may have been hitchiking to Vancouver, BC at the time.

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2016068993.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1975, the body of a Caucasian female was found floating in the Detroit River near Fighting Island.Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 110-150 lbs and her length was measured at 5'4", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She had pierced ears and her appendix was present. She is believed to have been in the water a few days to a week.

Jewelry: Chain necklace with a tiny bell, a key, and a stone bead pendant.
Shoes: Red, white, and blue laced shoes with a star design on the white stripes
Belt: Silver tie belt made of cloth
Jacket: Cloth, Brown, Waist length jacket, possibly imitation fur
Mark: Abdomen, Abdominal stretch marks suggesting she may have been pregnant at one time

Case reference: 2019045788.CaseDesc: On March 11, 2019, the remains of an adult male were found in a forested area in North Burnaby. He is estimated to have gone missing around March 2013, and may have been despondent at the time.

Socks: White, Black, Black on toe area and heal
Sweater: Synthetic, Light Green, Hoodie, Fleece, "Athletic" on the front, size M, Giordano brand
Belt: Leather, Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal steel clasp

Case reference: 2014001042.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified woman was found floating in the Atlantic Ocean near Georges Bank in Newfoundland and Labrador. Evidence shows that the woman had a previous caesarean section, as there was a scar on her pelvic area and there were sutures in her uterus. The woman had worn front top incisors with a slight overlap and had a fractured upper front tooth.

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2019040153.CaseDesc: On July 4, 2019, Shae-Lynn McAllister was seen for the last time at 10:30 pm leaving work at the A&W restaurant in Fairview, Alberta.

Case reference: 2008022299.CaseDesc: On Friday August 15, 2008, a male was recovered from the waters of the Detroit River, floating along the western shore of Fighting Island. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to a couple of weeks.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Signs of greying and a beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had lost all of his teeth in life, but it is likely that he wore dentures.
Pants: Grey, Sweatpants, Label back seam Donald Duck face and "Iceberg Jeans" label back pocket with Mickey Mouse face.
Shirt: Blue, Longsleeve, "Massini" brand long sleeved checkered shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014001214.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2012, the skeleton of a woman was discovered on the banks of the Rivière des Prairies, on the south side of Montreal near Gouin Street.

Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014006562.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2014, Kamalanathan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Markham, Ontario. His backpack, which contained all of his personal effects and his identification, was found near the Horseshoe Falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002401.CaseDesc: Jane was a student at Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario. She was last seen on August 9, 1975, in her apartment just before she went to bed at 2:00 a.m. The next day she was not seen or heard from, and was reported missing. Her personal belongings were left behind. It appears that Jane may have been a victim of foul play.

Scar: Forehead, Small round scare between the eyebrows.

Case reference: 2016006093.CaseDesc: On January 19, 2016, Michelle Smits was seen for the last time as she travelled from Cambridge, Ontario to the United States. In February, Michelle’s vehicle was found abandoned in Boston, Massachusetts.

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2014001277.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1987, Sukhminder Singh Grewal was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. He came to Canada and performed as a singer in an East Indian Music Troupe that toured across the country. Sukhminder has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2014004206.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1988, 3 people were visiting Leonard Kalichak at his residence and had decided to go out in a boat on Lake Dauphin, Manitoba. When they left shore they were faced with adverse conditions subsequently capsizing the boat. At this point, Mr. Kalichak immediately went under the water, possibly as a result of heavy clothing or an injury sustained when the boat capsized. Searches were conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations on the lake. Leonard Kalichak has never been found and he is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Berenice and Berangere Pare were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Berenice and Berangere, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005289.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1989, Clara Charles was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. On that day, Clara and her husband were moving and had a friend come over to help them. Clara told her husband that she and her friend were going to bring their furniture to their new address in Brampton, Ontario, and were to return later that evening.

Case reference: 2019050955.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2019 the remains of an unidentified man were discovered at 901 King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Torso (Front), Healed clavicle and rib fractures

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016066832.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1978, a body was recovered from the Detroit River. The body is believed to be that of a female. American money was found in the pockets of the pants. This person is believed to have been dead for several weeks to months.

Case reference: 2011001999.CaseDesc: Abdulatif Salman, age 25, suffers from schizophrenia. He left his home on Twyford Street,  on the evening of October 23, 2010 on foot, with no property, money or identification. He has not been heard from since.

Jacket: Grey, Blue, winter, has a hood

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2014043144.CaseDesc: On August 3, 2014, Aaron Dragonetti was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2016060405.CaseDesc: On April 24, 1976, a male, believed to be between the ages of 18 to 30, was recovered from the Niagara River, near the Canadian Niagara Power Plant. He is estimated to have been in the water from 3 to 6 weeks, possibly longer.

Teeth: Good, He has good teeth and no dental restorations.

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joesph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Mr. Arcand has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Mr. Cook drowned.

Teeth: Two front upper teeth are false

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2016034139.CaseDesc: Jessie Lobban has not been seen since June 16, 2016 when he left his residence at an unknown time. Jessie left behind his vehicle and his bicycle. This is out of character for him and his family is concerned.

Deformity: Left Little Finger, Tip bent inward
Right Little Finger, Tip bent inward

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red
Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets

Case reference: 2012749001.CaseDesc: Lonnie Boudreau was last seen in the city of Ottawa in February 1981. He has not been heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Short, Straight, parted from left to right
Teeth: Good, Small gap between the two front teeth
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Beauty mark

Case reference: 2022006239.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1990, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Vincent Stack was seen for the last time by his family members leaving his residence in Buffalo, New York. Vincent’s vehicle was located abandon in a parking lot near Niagara Falls State Park in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Case reference: 2008006899.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1966, Mr. Wynacht and two of his friends went hunting North of Sudbury along hydro pole lines, 20 miles north of Gauthiers corners on hwy 69, Kitchener Township. As a snow storm picked up, the hunters got separated along the pole lines, and Mr. Wynacht vanished. On the morning of Saturday November 5, 1966, a police cruiser led the search of the area with 35 citizens and two aircrafts. The search was completed on November 15, 1966, with negative results and no clue as to his disappearance had been uncovered.

Shirt: Wool, Red, Black, Checkered heavy doe skin

Case reference: 2014041781.CaseDesc: William Leslie has not been seen or heard from by anyone, including his family, since September, 1993. Mr. Leslie's belongings were found in a remote area. He had been staying in a tent in the bush Southeast of Beaverlodge in Alberta. It appeared the tent was pitched in the fall of 1993. His belongings were located under 2-3 feet of snow, along with his truck and bicycle. A jean jacket and leather jacket were located in the truck.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Short on top and long in back
Tattoo: Left Arm, "live your own life" in a ribbon

Case reference: 2017013186.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2017, Cameron Duffy was seen for the last time near the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Hood trimmed with fur

Case reference: 2017048277.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2017 at 11:00 pm, Christina Cooper was last seen leaving her boyfriend's residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014030834.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1967 at approximately 9:00 a.m. John Pawloski, his common-law wife and a young boy (9 years old) were fishing in the area of Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. John's fishing rod started to slip into the water and he ran to reach at it. He fell into the fast moving water. His wife attempted to rescue him, but she too slipped on the rocks and fell into the water. The young boy ran to get help and when he looked back he could no longer see the couple.  The body of John's wife was found down the river shortly after the incident. Searches for John's body were done by air, land and water but the body was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2013000082.CaseDesc: On April 26, 2011, Michel Petit was reported missing from his residence located in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. All his personal belongings were found in his apartment and his vehicle was parked in front of his home.

Case reference: 2012020123.CaseDesc: Paul Côté left his residence on June 13th 2000 and hasn’t been seen since. His car was located a few days later, on June 18th 2000, in a commercial parking lot in the city of Rimouski.

Case reference: 2014005610.CaseDesc: Roman Drag was last seen in the early hours of May 23, 2011 fishing at the top of the Bassano Dam in Bassano, AB. Roman and a friend were night fishing on the shore of the Bow River. His black jacket and fishing gear were found in the place where he was last seen. Search teams located a pair of glasses but were not able to locate Roman.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonneville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Jacket: Blue, Work style with name on it

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2017004181.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2017, Glen Swanton was seen for the last time in the area of Minden Hills, Ontario.  Mr. Swanton’s abandoned vehicle was later located in the area of Kinmount, Ontario, on January 18, 2017.

Foreign Object: Left Wrist, Metal plate in his wrist

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2014001795.CaseDesc: John Boone has been missing since December 24, 1998, in Saint John, NB. Mr. Boone suffers from depression and reportedly was not taking his medication. Mr. Boone's family is from the St Andrews, NB area.

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2014001004.CaseDesc: The remains of this unidentified male were found on Keats Island, near Gibsons, on May 3, 1992.

Case reference: 2006011099.CaseDesc: Kenneth Richard Wolfe was working on Caribou Lake, (15 km north west of Armstrong, Ontario). On October 8, 1970, he left alone in a 16 foot steel boat to work on a dock. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Wolfe.

Case reference: 2013000019.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2001, Terry Sagal was last seen leaving his South Regina house at approximately 11:00 am. Prior to leaving he took $50.00 cash and mentioned to his wife that he was going to get gas, pick up scotch and go to the Superstore. Shortly after leaving, Terry's Petro-Points card was used at the Albert South Petro Canada on a $26.00 purchase.

Case reference: 2014004911.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1974, Mr. Harper, his wife and their young child were out on the lake duck hunting and fishing. At one point in the day, the party stopped on shore to eat. During this stop, they noticed a storm coming in. By the time they left there were already waves forming as they started out across the lake. The wind increased and the waves were so strong that they would almost cause the vessel to flip over. The boat filled with water and a wave took Mr. Harper out of the boat. His wife and child drifted in the boat until they reached shore and were later rescued. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is presumed Mr. Harper drowned.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2015015739.CaseDesc: On October 5, 2014, at approximately 12:40 pm, the body of a black woman was seen floating near the bank of the Rivière des Prairies in the Saint-François district of Laval. She had no identification.

Tattoo: Left Wrist, African symbol-Adinkra-Hye won hye

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2012020124.CaseDesc: On October 5, 1995, Ronald Couture was seen for the last time at approximately 7:30 a.m. when he left his home in Terrebonne, Quebec. Ronald told his wife he was heading to the south shore area of the city to look for a job. The vehicle he was driving, a white 1993 Pontiac Grand-Am bearing Quebec licence plate WGT 621, was never located. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2013000065.CaseDesc: Pierrette Courcelles was last seen on November 22, 1991 in Montreal.

Tattoo: Right Arm, picture of a heart, a cross and an eagle with "ROBERT" (text)

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2013000099.CaseDesc: William Andersen and a co-worker were designated to conduct a wildlife survey in northern Manitoba. The men had flown into North Indian Lake on June 26th and departed by canoe from there. On the second day when the men attempted to shoot some rapids, their canoe hit a rock which overturned, throwing both men into the river. Mr. Andersen was not seen again. Air and land searches failed to locate Mr. Andersen and he is presumed dead as a result of drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Scar: 1" long scar 3/8" wide on the back of either the left or right hand.

Case reference: 2020016353.CaseDesc: In April 2020, Travis Hollar last contacted his family. During the time of his disappearance, Travis was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, and was living a transient lifestyle. In the past, he suffered from a brain injury which caused diminished cognitive abilities.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Shoes: White, North Star, North Star brand running shoes

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2006000799.CaseDesc: This adult male was seen walking on the ice on Lake Ontario. His body was later recovered from Lake Ontario, near Queens Quay.

Hair: Black, Short, Facial Stubble, Dark Eyebrows
Shirt: White, Black, T-shirt, 3/4 length, size Large, black sleeves
Blue, Grey, Plaid, Long sleeve with sleeves rolled up
Watch: Black, Bulova Set-O-Matic, Black nylon band
Jacket: Blue, Grey, Waist length, zippered vinyl hood, size Medium
Jeans: Blue, 30 inch waist, legs have been shortened

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2014005430.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2010, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Isaiah Lai was last seen attending church in Toronto, Ontario. Isaiah was visiting Canada on a student visa.

Case reference: 2014001333.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, members of the Canadian Armed Forces located the personal belongings of William Bereziuk washed up on an island in the Athabasca River 50 km north of Fort McMurray, Alberta. Mr. Bereziuk left Edmonton, Alberta in October of 1974 with the intention of making a canoe trip down the Athabasca River. He informed family members that he intended to spend the winter of 1974 in the Birch Mountain area of Alberta and would return to Edmonton in August of 1975. Mr. Bereziuk has never been heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Crucifix or scapular

Case reference: 2014003981.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1978, Wayne Kevin Spark was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. Wayne left home to attend Vancouver Community College but never showed up. Wayne has not been seen or heard from since.
